data.text:
I get being a busy CEO, because I am one too. There‚Äôs no resting when you‚Äôre sick - there‚Äôs answering emails in bed and rescheduling Zoom calls. There‚Äôs trying to occupy the kids or grandkids with toys or a snack while you fit in one more meeting. There is working more hours than you thought possible and maybe missing out on things to make this business work. There‚Äôs working late hours and knowing it‚Äôs for no one but yourself. There‚Äôs making your own schedule to watch your kids play or meet a friend for lunch because you are the boss. There‚Äôs you and your team getting the credit for the success you worked hard for. All of it is a lot. It takes a toll. The rules have changed. Work and Homelife are blending together and the old leadership rule book doesn‚Äôt have answers. You need a partner on this journey. Someone who you can go to for advice, to bounce ideas off of, and to look at your company and team and give you honest, unemotional feedback. That‚Äôs where I come in. I know what it‚Äôs like to be in your shoes because I AM in your shoes. Together, we work to create the best team for your business and give you tools to become the best leader you can be. You may not get the 4-hour work day foretold to you in entrepreneurial myth, but you will become more successful and have more time. Start now. Reach out at the link in the comments. üëá #FirstDayOfSpring #Entrepreneur #CEO #Leadership #BusinessSuccess

Feeling overwhelmed running your business? üò© You're not alone. In my new video, I uncover the reasons why so many business owners feel this way and, more importantly, how to take back control. üöÄ Whether it's setting clear goals, learning to delegate effectively, or mastering time management, I've got practical, actionable advice that will help you turn that stress into success. üíº‚ú® üì∫ Watch Now: https://lnkd.in/gQaXYP3q üîë What you'll learn: How to set SMART goals to reduce stress and improve focus. Tips on effective delegation to leverage your team's strengths. Time management techniques to keep you on track and productive. Don't let overwhelm hold you back! Take charge and lead your business towards growth and success. üí™ #SmallBusiness #Entrepreneurship #Leadership #BusinessGrowth #StressManagement #TimeManagement #Delegation #BusinessTips #Overwhelm #LeadershipSkills

üåü In the entrepreneurial world, where the terrain is ever-changing and the stakes are high, mistakes are often the unwelcome visitors we fear. But it's time to shift the narrative. "A mistake should be your teacher, not your attacker. A mistake is a lesson, not a loss." This profound quote is a beacon of resilience for impact-driven entrepreneurs. Each mistake you encounter is a stepping stone to greater wisdom and a testament to your courage to try. It's not there to deter you but to forge you into a savvy, adaptable, and more prepared business leader. üöÄ Embrace your mistakes. Analyze them, not to tally your losses, but to compile your learnings. Turn each 'error' into an 'editor' to refine your strategy, your approach, and your vision. Let‚Äôs not allow the fear of imperfection to hold us back from our ambitions. Instead, let it propel us towards our greatest potential. #ResilienceInBusiness #LearnFromMistakes #EntrepreneurMindset #BusinessGrowth #LeadershipDevelopment #MindsetShift #coaching

Reach out at the link in the comments. üëá #FirstDayOfSpring #Entrepreneur #CEO #Leadership #BusinessSuccess

If you are a company founder, odds are that you are: - a strategic thinker - a creative problem solver - awesome at owning big relationships - have 20 ideas before you finish your first cup of coffee In other words, a textbook Visionary. BEFORE your daily work is dominated by the minutiae required to run a business, go find someone who is gifted at: - execution - managing people - driving accountability - staying focused on a limited set of priorities i.e., an Integrator. Your investors, leadership team, employees, family and friends, and the quality of your sleep will thank you for it! #leadership #management #entrepreneurship

I've always considered myself a bit of a rebel. You have to be an entrepreneur for over a decade, helping people strategize through their most significant business challenges. But I will NEVER not be stunned by a face tattoo. This morning, I saw a certain celeb with a face tattoo of her kids' names. I thought, "Okay, cute," but wow, she really said, "I want this on my forehead forever." It got me thinking: if I absolutely had to get a face tattoo, what would it be? As a strategist, people tell me everything. I am an information sponge, absorbing every detail our clients share. However, I find one question very effective in cutting through the noise and getting to the heart of any obstacle. I borrowed it from a fantastic book called 'The Coaching Habit' by Michael Bungay Stanier, and have been using it for years. That question is: "What is the real challenge here?" and it's what I would have tattooed on my forehead. üòÖ This question helps people focus on what they can control and what's actionable. It opens up our work together to find what will actually move the needle forward and have an impact. So, next time you feel stuck or are spinning your wheels, ask yourself: 'What's the real challenge here?' You might be surprised by the clarity it brings. #businessgrowth #businesstrategy #strategist #entreprenuership #Leadership #TheCoachingHabit #StrategicThinking

Don't Give Up Too Soon... Bridget here, and I've got a heart-to-heart for all you incredible entrepreneurs, coaches, and leaders out there. In my latest video, I share a deep dive into the challenges we all face‚Äîthe moments when the journey gets tough, and throwing in the towel seems like the easy way out. Let's be real ‚Äì the entrepreneurial path is no cakewalk. We've all hit those roadblocks that make us question if we're on the right track. But here's the deal: Success often lies just beyond the point where most people give up. In this video, I'm breaking down the common pitfalls that hold us back and sharing some game-changing insights on how to push through the tough times. From mindset shifts to practical strategies, we're crafting a roadmap for resilience and success together. Get ready for a dose of motivation, a sprinkle of tough love, and a whole lot of empowerment! Tag your fellow go-getters, and let's create a community that thrives on perseverance. Remember, we're in this journey together ‚Äì let's go beyond limits and conquer our dreams! ‚Äì #bridget_hom #business #motivational #leadership #stuckonready #NeverGiveUp #EntrepreneurialSpirit #CoachingJourney #LeadershipMindset

How good are you at reflecting on the month past? Yesterday for me, it was time to review February! I reviewed 1Ô∏è‚É£things that went well, 2Ô∏è‚É£things that I want to improve and 3Ô∏è‚É£build a bit of a go forward plan for March. Incorporating my #personal and #professional life As a typical type A #entrepreneur, I‚Äôm always going and not good at reflecting, reevaluating and repurposing, so I‚Äôm trying to get better at this in 2024 I have a great structure I have implemented for a personal monthly review that takes about one hour allows you to really think about the previous month. Give me a comment below üëá if you would like a copy of the template. If you have been thinking about this consider this your challenge and ‚Äúcall out‚Äù to get into this habit #leadership #review #month #authenticity

3 silent killers of business growth. (Luckily, all three are easy to avoid with the right guidance.) Here they are. üëá At the end of the day, we are all human. And all humans make mistakes. However, after working with many business owners over the years, I‚Äôve found there are common mistakes many business owners make‚Ä¶ ‚Ä¶ ones that stifle their growth, and they don‚Äôt even realize they‚Äôre making them! But these can be avoided with the support of an advisor or CFO. Here are a few of these common mistakes ‚¨áÔ∏è ‚ùå Not outsourcing or delegating soon enough ‚ùå Spending too much time on activities that don‚Äôt grow the business ‚ùå Avoiding investing in the people and resources that are needed to succeed Without an advisor or a CFO, it can be challenging to recognize when you are making mistakes that could be stunting your company's success. This is one of the reasons I always tell business owners to work with an advisor! üëâ So they can help you spot these red flags early on. Have you ever made any of these mistakes in your business? If you answered yes, then maybe it‚Äôs time for us to chat about how having an advisor could help. DM me today! #entrepreneurship #management #leadership #future #success
